tweets.text:
Is it right that the regulation of landfills has got us to this point. 

We have been failed by the @EnvAgencyMids and @BorisJohnson    

If a regulator has no idea what‚Äôs wrong, how can they fix it?   

They can‚Äôt even confirm it will be fixed in a year.   
#StopTheStink https://t.co/KuBMTOOtLG

@fayedavies @kdlang @StinkStopthe I keep seeing your tweets about this. Its atrocious that you and others have to suffer this and nothing is being done. Is there any way any of us not in this situation can help?

@MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe @PHE_uk @AaronBell4NUL It would stand to reason that the 24 hour limit was intended so that it was never breached.   

What we have here is a disaster that is being played down by flawed science.  The reality is this is a new phenomenon.

They all hide behind each other @EnvAgency @PHE_EoEngland @michaelkbrodie @JamesBevanEA It‚Äôs actually embarrassing. While no one addresses the elephant in the room - let‚Äôs hope noones kid dies #stopthestink https://t.co/Y5HlPE9Dh1

@JonnyEcology Two decades ago this sort of thing was less often seen, but since the @Conservatives deep funding cuts @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland have been rendered silent witnesses. Cross compliance is ignored by farmers and agencies alike

@richbeanjohnson @fayedavies They have a plan but they have no clue what they‚Äôre doing! And how can the community ever trust them when even with all this scrutiny they still won‚Äôt follow the rules?! answer is they‚Äôll never be trusted! @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA #stopthestink
Gobsmacked that some farmers still think that herbiciding an entire fallow field is completely ok https://t.co/TqfNBk5Wui

@EnvAgencyMids The site is not behaving as expected, you don‚Äôt know what to https://t.co/5qYxmpCsCa have no plan & refuse to give a date that the odours will be mitigated. Recognised rising complaints. You are baffled but allow @RedIndustries2  to still accept waste it‚Äôs madness #stopthestink

entity.name: SAS: Who Dares Wins
entity.description: A group of ex-Special Forces soldiers recreate the selection process for the SAS they themselves passed and put 30 civilian men through it.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins for Stand Up to Cancer
entity.description: In `Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins', twelve well-known public figures from the worlds of entertainment, sports and politics embark on the one of the toughest tests of their lives as they try to pass a unique version of the infamous SAS Selection test over a gruelling seven-day period, led by tough chief instructor Ant Middleton and his team of staff - Foxy, Billy, Ollie and Jay - who don't care how famous the recruits are, how many followers they have, or what they have done until now. As soon as they enter the selection process their celebrity status vanishes. Will the celebs have what it takes to make it through this unique version of SAS selection?
